column4: hi, i want to create a file sharing server by sharing a folder on ubuntu - whats the difference between cifs, nfs and smb? the rest of my network is windows machines
what os's are you shareing to and from?
i want to share a folder on ubuntu 10.04 to a mixed windows xp & 7 network
then you want to use samba/smb  - or set up ssh, and use winscp on the windows machines.
right click on a folder, share.. and  in theory that will set up samba and share that folder for you.
you may need to set a samba password for the user with 'sudo smbpasswd -a YOURUSERNAME'
the smbpasswd would be the user a client uses to login?
the smb passwiord can be identical to their normall password. or not..
in smb.conf, how do i specify to use the smbpasswd users? it looks like it let my W7 PC login as a guest
i use the same user name on linux and windows. It should ask what user to login as i think 'unknown users' get remapped to guest.
so how do i forbid guests from logging in?
in smb.conf there is a section to share the users 'home' directory - i normally enable that to share their whole home dir. that way i dont mess with specific shares.
that would be in the smb.fonf somewhere.. map guest to  somthing I think.  but what if you want publuic shares?
the samba docs (books) in the damba-doc package. have details on all this.
you can access the /servername/otherusername    share and i think it will ask for the other users password
by default i think   the home share. tries to access the current users name.
i always fine it easier to just use identical user names on my linux and windows machines.
right now, windows 7 isn't asking me for any creds, but i can RWX to my own directory (same username on win/ubu)
but i can READ other users directories
you want to be able to write to theirs as well?
i want their directories to be secured (i.e., when i type /servername/otheruser, windows 7 should ask me for their user/pass - right now it isn't doing that)
they need to set their permissions on their homes I guess..
